docblock.description: Library to deal with processing and building HTML forms.

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2012, Idea 112 Ltd., All rights reserved.

docblock.description: Abstract base class representing a container for form elements and error messages.
docblock.long-description: A container might be an entire form (the Form class is an instance of Form_Container), or it could be a form element containing child elements.

docblock.description: Test if the element has a scalar value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: `true` if the element has a scalar value, `null` if the element is still undefined

docblock.description: Test if the element has an array value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: `true` if the element has an array value, `null` if the element is still undefined

docblock.description: Implement `Countable::count`.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Number of child values (both submitted and default)

docblock.description: Implement `Iterator::current`.
Implement `Iterator::key`.
Implement `Iterator::next`.
Implement `Iterator::rewind`.
Implement `Iterator::valid`.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the current element is valid

docblock.description: Implement `ArrayAccess::offsetGet`.
Implement `ArrayAccess::offsetExists`.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if value exists for the child element

docblock.description: Implement `ArrayAccess::offsetSet`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: New value for the child element

docblock.description: Implement `ArrayAccess::offsetUnset`.
Return the names of all child elements.
Return a child element instance.
Test if a child value exists.
Set a new value for a child element.
Delete a child value.
Set an error for the container, clearing previous errors.
docblock.long-description:
All previous errors with the same $code will be cleared. The default error code is :default — if $code is omitted, only the messages for error code :default will be cleared and the new error will be added with a :default error code.

If the $error parameter is null, only an error condition is raised for the specified error code, but no message is added.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Form_Container instance, for call chaining

docblock.description: Add an error for the container.
docblock.long-description:
The default error code is :default — if $code is omitted, the message will be added with a :default error code.

If the $error parameter is null, only an error condition is raised for the specified error code, but no message is added.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Form_Container instance, for call chaining

docblock.description: Check if an error condition is raised for the container.
docblock.long-description: If $code is omitted, has_errors will return true if any error code has been raised for the container. If you want to check specifically for an error condition on the :default error code, you need to call has_errors(':default') explicitly.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if there are errors raised

docblock.description: Check if an error condition is raised for the container or any of its children.
docblock.long-description: If $code is omitted, contains_errors will return true if any error code has been raised for the container. If you want to check specifically for an error condition on the :default error code, you need to call contains_errors(':default') explicitly.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if there are errors raised

docblock.description: Get error messages for the container.
docblock.long-description: If $code is omitted, get_errors will return all error messages for all error codes raised for the container. If you want to get error messages specifically for the :default error code, you need to call get_errors(':default') explicitly.

docblock.description: Get error codes raised for the element.
Return a string if an error condition is raised for the container.
docblock.long-description: Intended usage: <input <?php echo $form->field->if_errors('class="error"') ?> ...>

tag.name: param
tag.description: String to return if condition is raised

docblock.description: Clear errors for the container.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Error code to clear, or all errors if null

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Form_Container instance, for call chaining

docblock.description: Clear errors for the container and all its child elements.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Error code to clear, or all errors if null

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Form_Container instance, for call chaining

docblock.description: Library to deal with processing and building HTML forms.

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2012, Idea 112 Ltd., All rights reserved.

docblock.description: Class representing a form element.
Construct a form element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Form instance the element belongs to

docblock.description: Get the element's name.
Get the element's default value.
Get the element's submitted value.
Get the element's value (the submitted value or the default value if not submitted).
Get the type of the element's value.
Return the element's name mangled into an identifier.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Prefix to prepend to the identifier

tag.name: param
tag.description: Suffix to append to the identifier

docblock.description: Get the value of the element as a scalar.
docblock.long-description: If the value is an array, as_scalar will return null.

docblock.description: Get the value of the element as an array.
docblock.long-description: If the value is a scalar, as_array will return it wrapped in an array.

docblock.description: Get the value of the element as a HTML-safe string.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value with HTML special chars escaped

docblock.description: Get the value of the element as a URL-safe string.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value with URL special chars escaped

docblock.description: Return an `id=".
docblock.long-description: .."` HTML attribute for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Prefix to prepend to the identifier

tag.name: param
tag.description: Suffix to append to the identifier

docblock.description: Return a `name=".
docblock.long-description: .."` HTML attribute for the element.

docblock.description: Return a `value=".
docblock.long-description:
.."` HTML attribute.

Some elements need to render a value different from their submitted value, so the actual value to render can be overridden using the $value parameter.

docblock.description: Return an `id=".
docblock.long-description: .."and aname="..."` HTML attributes for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Prefix to prepend to the identifier

tag.name: param
tag.description: Suffix to append to the identifier

docblock.description: Return an `id=".
docblock.long-description: ..", aname="..."and avalue="..."` HTML attributes.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Prefix to prepend to the identifier

tag.name: param
tag.description: Suffix to append to the identifier

docblock.description: Return a `checked` HTML attribute if the value matches.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to compare agains the element's value

docblock.description: Return a `selected` HTML attribute if the value matches.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Value to compare agains the element's value

docblock.description: Return `<input type="hidden">` HTML tags for the element and all its children.
Return a query string containing the value of the element and all its children.
Return a `<label>` HTML tag for the element.
docblock.long-description: Since some elements have multiple tags with different values in an HTML form (e.g., radio buttons with the same name but different values), they need to have different IDs based on their values; if you provide a $value parameter, it will be appended as -$value as a suffix to the element's ID.

docblock.description: Render an `<input type="text">` HTML tag for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Render an `<input type="password">` HTML tag for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Render a `<textarea>` HTML tag for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Render an `<input type="checkbox">` HTML tag for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Render an `<input type="radio">` HTML tag for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Render a single `<option>` HTML tag for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Render a `<select>` HTML tag containing a list of options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Render a `<input type="submit">` HTML tag for the element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Custom attributes to add to the tag

docblock.description: Library to deal with processing and building HTML forms.

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2012, Idea 112 Ltd., All rights reserved.

docblock.description: Base form exception class.
Type exception.
docblock.long-description: Thrown when type-incompatible operation is attempted, e.g. adding a child element to a scalar-value parent.

docblock.description: Library to deal with processing and building HTML forms.

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Copyright (c) 2012, Idea 112 Ltd., All rights reserved.

docblock.description: Pull in subclass definitions.
Class representing the entire form.
Instantiate a Form from custom submitted data.
Instantiate a Form from GET data.
docblock.long-description: The $context parameter has two purposes: 1. Determines the sub-element of the $_GET array to use as submitted values; 2. Sets the Form name, which is used as prefix for the element names.

docblock.description: Instantiate a Form from POST data.
docblock.long-description: The $context parameter has two purposes: 1. Determines the sub-element of the $_POST array to use as submitted values; 2. Sets the Form name, which is used as prefix for the element names.

docblock.description: Instantiate a Form from both GET and POST data.
docblock.long-description:
The $context parameter has two purposes: 1. Determines the sub-elements of the $_GET and $_POST arrays to use as submitted values; 2. Sets the Form name, which is used as prefix for the element names.

POST values take precedence over GET values.

docblock.description: Test if the form has been submitted.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if form has been submitted, false otherwise

docblock.description: Set default values for form elements that has not been submitted.
docblock.long-description: The defaults are used for elements that weren't submitted with the form (e.g. checkboxes that weren't checked) and for default values before the form is initially submitted.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The form instance, for call chaining

docblock.description: Get the form elements' values.
Return `<input type="hidden">` HTML tags for all form elements.
Return a query string containing all form elements' values.
